page.title: 02WOKINGHAM _ LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {WOKINGHAM}is situated in the Royal County of Berkshire. WOKINGHAM is derived from Anglo Saxon words Uuocing or Woccing. Ham means town.{MARKET} established 1227 to present day.{FAIRS two each year since 1285.{LOCAL GOV. } Borough Council since 1885. Mayor and councillors hold annual office. 1985 centennial celebrations of previous Aldermen and Mayors.{ECCLESIASTICAL {HISTORY}fourteenth century. All Saints Church - in 1985 major restoration was financed by public appeal.{INDUSTRIES} - WOKINGHAM renowned for bell making, silk weaving and brick making. l985 electronic engineering and computer technology.{PROTECTED BUILDINGS}- Rose Street - half timbered 14th century buildings, Ye Olde Rose Inne, the Bush, Montague House, Markham House, Tudor House, The Terrace, Ashridge Farm, Town Hall - Gothic Architecture.
